alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Jackson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:32PM EDT until March 28 at 11:25PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale, Shoals, Williams, Seymour, and Bedford. Big Blue River at Shelbyville. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Flatrock River near Columbus. .Significant rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches last week has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with several smaller tributaries. Moderate flooding is occurring on a small portion of the East Fork White River, and is expected to develop in the coming days on the lower reaches of the White and Wabash Rivers. Water continues to rise in many locations. The crests on the main stem rivers are in the following locations currently. On the Wabash, near Lafayette. On the White, near Spencer, and along the East Fork White, between Seymour and Rivervale. Most smaller tributaries are past crest and falling. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas, particularly in southwest Indiana along the lower reaches of the main stem rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.1 feet, The lowest portions of the parking lot for the Holiday Inn Express near I-65 was extensively flooded in March 2008. Also flooded were the nearby walking trails and the basketball goal. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EDT Sunday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue falling to 2.4 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
